result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME.
Consecutive to: TO any other sentence
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Nano Aguirre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  10 days HOC,  consecutive.  Due & owing.

Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 99 days time served.  To be served straight time. 

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/10/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel request a short adjournment to talk with the defendant's probation agent.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre not in court, in custody.  Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin  for plea and sentencing on .
Defendant has a VOP hold.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in court with attorney Daryl Kastenson for Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Orlando Nano Aguirre in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
